content:
While I'm able to compile locally a 4b-based guide, the publication on build.fhir.org fails. (see e.g. http://build.fhir.org/ig/HL7/fhir-forfair/branches/master/failure/build.log).
It seems that the problem is the identification of the 4b package discussed in the shorthand stream.....
sushi will have to be fixed to fetch r4b not r5
@Chris Moesel any plan for this ?

We just figured out what's going wrong and logged an issue for it late last week. At that point, our current development sprint was already fully planned and in motion, but we may still try to sneak it in this week. I'll see what we can do.

Screen-Shot-2021-06-29-at-08.57.48.png Hi, I'm also getting an error with this, but I'm trying to see where I can change the configuration to look for R4. My config file looks likes this. Is this due to the same issue?

id: IHE-SDC-eCC-On-FHIR
canonical: http://bhl7.org/fhir/ihe-sdc-on-fhir
name: IHE-SDC-eCC-On-FHIR
status: draft
version: 0.1.0
fhirVersion: 4.0.1
copyrightYear: 2021+
releaseLabel: ci-build
Never mind! Figured out it was an example FSH file that wasn't pointed at the created profile correctly

@Alex Goel - You have fhirVersion: 4.0.1, so that IG is using the standard R4 release (not R4B). Assuming you're not trying to do anything that requires R4B, then what you're encountering seems to be a separate issue. And it looks like it is in the IG Publisher code after SUSHI completes, so likely not SUSHI-related. If it's the org.hl7.fhir.r5.renderers that is throwing you off, I think that is a red herring. I believe @Grahame Grieve uses some code in the r5 Java namespace even to render R4 IGs.
Just saw your update. Glad you figured it out!
